page.title: 02Royston Street Names
page.content: Royston street names are interesting and tell us about the area in the past and the present. The main roads often tell us where they lead-e.g.London Road, Baldock Rd. One of the main roads, now the A 14, has been called the Old North Road for hundreds of years. Stage-coaches used to travel along it to Huntingdon. Market Hill has been the site of the market since the reign of Richard 1. Fish Hill used to be where fish were sold. Dog Kennel Lane is where James 1 kept his hunting dogs when he lived in the Old Palace on Kneesworth Street. One of the newest roads is called King James's Way. On one of the newest estates built during the last 10 years all the streets are named after poets and play-wrights e.g.Burns Rd.,Shakespear.
